pr_title: NXP-29642: Use an non-interrupted Thread to close Kafka consumers

timeline.message: NXP-29642: Use an non-interrupted Thread to close Kafka consumers

timeline.bodyText: This will close the consumer without throwing errors, but this is not the cause of NXP-29642 right?
timeline.author: bdelbosc

replies.bodyText:
Indeed, the proposal didn't change this aspect, we were leading there before as Thread.currentThread().isInterrupted() should return the same thing as Thread.interrupted(), or I am missing something.
I think it might be related to NXP-29642 as the last log we've got is about a SleepWork timeout which is owned by another test. Furthermore, the assertion is about 2 != 1 where 2 is scheduled + running, I'm suspecting to have 1 for running due to a SleepWork still there.
I will also get more feedback by running this code, there may be a shallowed exception somewhere.
replies.author: kevinleturc
